# Fundamental principles

- Dimensional analysis can be used to simplify equations into dimensionless variables. 
- This type of analysis only works on dimensionally homogeous equations -> have the same dimensions. 

# Example:

Let's estimate the drag experimenced by an object immersed in a current.

Assumptions:
- The immersed object is a smooth sphere.
- The velocity of the current V is constant. 

The drag force F is a function of:
- velocity (V)
- diameter of the sphere (D)
- density of water ![equation](http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%20%28%5Crho%29%20&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0)
- dynamic viscosity ![equation](http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%20%28%20%5Ceta%20%29%20&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0)

![equation](http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=F%20%3D%20f%28V%2C%20D%2C%20%20%5Crho%20%2C%20%5Ceta%20%29&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0)

```{r, eval=FALSE}
F = f(V,D,p,n)
```
